titles.title: Northern Mariana Islands Delegate Act
Northern Mariana Islands Delegate Act
To provide for representation of the Northern Mariana Islands by a nonvoting Delegate in the House of Representatives.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 104-856.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 463.

bill.summary: 9/27/1996--Reported to House amended. Northern Mariana Islands Delegate Act - Requires the Northern Mariana Islands to be represented in the Congress by an elected nonvoting Delegate to the House of Representatives. Provides that: (1) the Resident Representative of the Islands (as authorized by the Covenant to Establish a Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands in Political Union with the United States of America, approved March 24, 1976) shall be the Delegate; and (2) such Delegate shall not be elected before the general Federal election of 1998.
